***** Marathi[edit] *****
**** Etymology[edit] ****
Inherited from Sanskrit *कादृक् (kādṛk), from कीदृश (kīdṛśa) + -क (-ka).
Cognate to Gujarati કે (ke), Hindi क्या (kyā).
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): /kaj/
**** Pronoun[edit] ****
काय • (kāy)
   1. what
            तुझं नाव काय?
                  tuj̈ha nāv kāy?
                  What is your name? (informal)
**** See also[edit] ****
    * कधी (kadhī)
    * कसे (kase)
    * का (kā)
    * कोण (koṇ)
    * कोणते (koṇte)
**** References[edit] ****
    * Turner,_Ralph_Lilley (1969–1985), “kīdŕ̊k”, inA Comparative Dictionary of
      the Indo-Aryan Languages, London: Oxford University Press

*** Pronoun[edit] ***
काय
   1. Devanagari_script form of kāya, which is instrumental/dative/ablative/
      genitive/locative singular of का (kā, “who (f.)”)
